author: Vanessa Redgrave
method: Melt the butter in a medium saucepan. Add the onion and leek and cook until softened - about 10-15 minutes on a low heat.  Add a splash of white wine, the potatoes, stock and seasoning and simmer until the potatoes are tender. Liquidise using a hand-held blender, or transfer to a liquidiser. Pass through a sieve before adding the milk and cream. Chill in the fridge until ready to serve. Sprinkle with chives and parsley just before serving.
ingredients: 55g/2oz butter,  1 onion, chopped,  300g/10&frac12oz leek, finely sliced,  splash white wine,  110g/4oz potatoes, peeled and sliced,  290ml/10fl oz/½pint vegetable stock,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  290ml/10fl oz/½pint milk,  2 tbsp cream,  handful snipped chives,  small handful chopped parsley
